# The `MemoryDepChecker` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Checks memory dependences among accesses to the same underlying object to determine whether there vectorization is legal or not (and at which vectorization factor). <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MemoryDepChecker</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Checks memory dependences among accesses to the same underlying object to determine whether there vectorization is legal or not (and at which vectorization factor).

Note: This class will compute a conservative dependence for access to different underlying pointers. Clients, such as the loop vectorizer, will sometimes deal these potential dependencies by emitting runtime checks.

We use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> framework to symbolically evalutate access functions pairs. Since we currently don&#39;t restructure the loop we can rely on the program order of memory accesses to determine their safety. At the moment we will only deem accesses as safe for:
<ul>
<li>A negative constant distance assuming program order.
Safe: tmp = a&#91;i + 1&#93;; OR a&#91;i + 1&#93; = x; a&#91;i&#93; = tmp; y = a&#91;i&#93;;
The latter case is safe because later checks guarantuee that there can&#39;t be a cycle through a phi node (that is, we check that &quot;x&quot; and &quot;y&quot; is not the same variable: a header phi can only be an induction or a reduction, a reduction can&#39;t have a memory sink, an induction can&#39;t have a memory source). This is important and must not be violated (or we have to resort to checking for cycles through memory).</li>
<li>A positive constant distance assuming program order that is bigger than the biggest memory access.
tmp = a&#91;i&#93; OR b&#91;i&#93; = x a&#91;i+2&#93; = tmp y = b&#91;i+2&#93;;
Safe distance: 2 x sizeof(a&#91;0&#93;), and 2 x sizeof(b&#91;0&#93;), respectively.</li>
<li>Zero distances and all accesses have the same size.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 90 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.

<EnumerationListItem name="Unsafe">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

The order of the elements is important and has to be from most permissive to least permissive.

### getDependenceDistanceStrideAndSize() {#a931e0e5a507e69b39f01cb2ad63eb1fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::variant&lt; MemoryDepChecker::Dependence::DepType, MemoryDepChecker::DepDistanceStrideAndSizeInfo &gt; MemoryDepChecker::getDependenceDistanceStrideAndSize (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; AInst, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp; B, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; BInst)</>}>
Get the dependence distance, strides, type size and whether it is a write for the dependence between A and B.

Returns a DepType, if we can prove there&#39;s no dependence or the analysis fails. Outlined to lambda to limit he scope of various temporary variables, like A/BPtr, StrideA/BPtr and others. Returns either the dependence result, if it could already be determined, or a struct containing (Distance, Stride, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a>, AIsWrite, BIsWrite).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00400">400</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp/#l01884">1884</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp">LoopAccessAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isDependent() {#a38cc31094ed54fccc8089be343bf12d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemoryDepChecker::Dependence::DepType MemoryDepChecker::isDependent (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp; A, unsigned AIdx, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp; B, unsigned BIdx)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether there is a plausible dependence between the two accesses.

Access <code>A</code> must happen before <code>B</code> in program order. The two indices identify the index into the program order map.

This function checks whether there is a plausible dependence (or the absence of such can&#39;t be proved) between the two accesses. If there is a plausible dependence but the dependence distance is bigger than one element access it records this distance in <code>MinDepDistBytes</code> (if this distance is smaller than any other distance encountered so far). Otherwise, this function returns true signaling a possible dependence.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00352">352</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp/#l02014">2014</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp">LoopAccessAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemoryDepChecker::mergeInStatus (<a href="#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400">VectorizationSafetyStatus</a> S)</>}>
Updates the current safety status with <code>S</code>.

We can go from Safe to either PossiblySafeWithRtChecks or Unsafe and from PossiblySafeWithRtChecks to Unsafe.

### MaxSafeVectorWidthInBits {#ac95d20df703b7cf86864aeed21d99799}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::MemoryDepChecker::MaxSafeVectorWidthInBits = -1U</>}>
Number of elements (from consecutive iterations) that are safe to operate on simultaneously, multiplied by the size of the element in bits.

The size of the element is taken from the memory access that is most restrictive.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00305">305</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### MaxTargetVectorWidthInBits {#a45b913ea0c21c016337a92b6c47809d4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::MemoryDepChecker::MaxTargetVectorWidthInBits = 0">
The maximum width of a target&#39;s vector registers multiplied by 2 to also roughly account for additional interleaving.

Is used to decide if a backwards dependence with non-constant stride should be classified as backwards-vectorizable or unknown (triggering a runtime check).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00329">329</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### MinDepDistBytes {#a23801138e343fc0836e546cf1a05fff9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::MemoryDepChecker::MinDepDistBytes = 0</>}>
The smallest dependence distance in bytes in the loop.

This may not be the same as the maximum number of bytes that are safe to operate on simultaneously.

### PSE {#a8e702110a5b6038b4bbfcb53db983ea6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PredicatedScalarEvolution&amp; llvm::MemoryDepChecker::PSE</>}>
A wrapper around <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>, used to add runtime <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> checks, and applies dynamic knowledge to simplify <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions and convert them to a more usable form.

We need this in case assumptions about <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions need to be made in order to avoid unknown dependences. For example we might assume a unit stride for a pointer in order to prove that a memory access is strided and doesn&#39;t wrap.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00280">280</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
